snippet: Four officials who were placed on administrative leave after the deadly attack last year on the United States diplomatic post in Benghazi have been reinstated and given new assignments.
abstract: Four midlevel State Department officials placed on administrative leave after deadly 2012 attack on United States mission in Benghazi, Libya, have been reinstated by Sec of State John Kerry and given new assignments; Republican Rep Darrell Issa of California accuses State Department of shirking accountability.
lead_paragraph: Four officials who were placed on administrative leave after the deadly attack last year on the United States diplomatic post in Benghazi have been reinstated and given new assignments.

headline.main: U.S. Diplomats, Relieved After Libyan Attack, Are Reinstated
headline.print_headline: Washington: U.S. Diplomats, Relieved After Libyan Attack, Are Reinstated
